result.execSummary:
All charges against Antroine D Grayson in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Antroine D Grayson is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

01:05 PM Defendant Antroine D Grayson in court, in custody, with attorney J Andrew Herbers.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dr Niess appears by zoom.
All parties have received the reports in this matter.  
State reports there is 68 days credit in this matter and moves to dismiss the matter as that is over the time in this matter. 
Defense does not object. 
Court dismisses matter.
Motion hearing on July 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

filed by Atty. J. Andrew Herbers
** Per court stack on the 7/21/22 hearing date**
Competency hearing on July 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

09:24 AM Attorney J Andrew Herbers in court.   Defendant Antroine D Grayson did not appear.   Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests a Competency hearing due to discussions had with defendant.  Court sets Competency hearing.  Clerk consulted with Dr. Niess' office she is confirmed to appear by Zoom.  Competency hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Competency Evaluation prepared by Dr. Jenna Niess
Review hearing on June 23, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Review hearing on June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

02:27 PM Defendant Antroine D Grayson in court, in custody.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states his first name is Anthony.    Attorney Cassandra Miller appears as friend of the court.  Defendant was not evaluated by the public defender's office, not on the list.  DEFENSE COUNSEL REQUESTS ORDER FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an inpatient basis within 30 days.  Cash bond can be converted to a signature bond without a further hearing after the evaluation is completed.  Review hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
